intro: Homalocalyx coarctatus, commonly known as the narrow-leafed sandstone vine, is a climbing plant native to the tropical regions of Australia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its slender, twining stems and small, heart-shaped leaves. The flowers are typically pale yellow or greenish-white, with five petals and a prominent central column. It thrives in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in dry, open habitats. The plant is notable for its ability to tolerate arid conditions and its role in stabilizing soil in its native environment.
